newsitem.title: USA: Titan Wheel unit buys stake in firm.
newsitem.headline: Titan Wheel unit buys stake in firm.

text.p: Titan Tire Corp, a subsidiary of Titan Wheel International Inc, said it acquired 19 percent of Condere Corp.
Condere is the parent company of Fidelity Tire Manufacturing Co of Natchez, Miss.
Condere posted sales of $120 million in 1996, but also declared more than $8 million in losses. Condere filed Chapter 11 bankruptcy on May 13, 1997, Titan said.
On May 14, the Condere board elected Titan President Maurice Taylor Jr as chairman, chief executive officer and president of Condere, with an annual salary of one dollar.
"It is my intent to try and turn around Fidelity Tire," Taylor said.
Titan makes mounted tire and wheel systems for off-highway equipment.
